messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the php program, here is the asan report

The sanitizer detected a heap use after free vulnerability. The explanation of the vulnerability is: Memory is accessed after it has been freed, leading to undefined behavior and security risks. Here is the detail: 

READ of size 4 at 0x50600001c220 thread T0
    - zend_gc_delref Zend/zend_types.h:1228:2
    - zend_objects_store_del Zend/zend_objects_API.c:185:4
    - rc_dtor_func Zend/zend_variables.c:57:2
    - i_zval_ptr_dtor Zend/zend_variables.h:44:4
    - zval_ptr_dtor Zend/zend_variables.c:84:2
    - zim_SplDoublyLinkedList_offsetSet ext/spl/spl_dllist.c:740:4
    - zend_call_function Zend/zend_execute_API.c:962:4
    - zend_call_known_function Zend/zend_execute_API.c:1043:23
    - zend_call_known_instance_method Zend/zend_API.h:753:2
    - zend_call_known_instance_method_with_2_params Zend/zend_execute_API.c:1063:2
    - zend_std_write_dimension Zend/zend_object_handlers.c:999:3
    - zend_assign_to_object_dim Zend/zend_execute.c:1437:2
    - ZEND_ASSIGN_DIM_SPEC_CV_CONST_OP_DATA_CONST_HANDLER Zend/zend_vm_execute.h:41725:4
    - execute_ex Zend/zend_vm_execute.h:55866:7
    - zend_execute Zend/zend_vm_execute.h:60439:2
    - zend_execute_scripts Zend/zend.c:1842:4
    - php_execute_script main/main.c:2578:13
    - do_cli sapi/cli/php_cli.c:964:5
    - main sapi/cli/php_cli.c:1334:18

0x50600001c220 is located 0 bytes inside of 56-byte region [0x50600001c220,0x50600001c258)
freed by thread T0 here:
    - tracked_free Zend/zend_alloc.c:2851:2
    - _efree_custom Zend/zend_alloc.c:2486:3
    - _efree Zend/zend_alloc.c:2606:3
    - zend_objects_store_del Zend/zend_objects_API.c:204:3
    - zend_object_release Zend/zend_objects_API.h:75:3
    - zend_objects_destroy_object Zend/zend_objects.c:180:3
    - zend_objects_store_del Zend/zend_objects_API.c:184:4
    - rc_dtor_func Zend/zend_variables.c:57:2
    - i_zval_ptr_dtor Zend/zend_variables.h:44:4
    - zval_ptr_dtor Zend/zend_variables.c:84:2
    - zim_SplDoublyLinkedList_offsetSet ext/spl/spl_dllist.c:740:4
    - zend_call_function Zend/zend_execute_API.c:962:4
    - zend_call_known_function Zend/zend_execute_API.c:1043:23
    - zend_call_known_instance_method Zend/zend_API.h:753:2
    - zend_call_known_instance_method_with_2_params Zend/zend_execute_API.c:1063:2
    - zend_std_write_dimension Zend/zend_object_handlers.c:999:3
    - zend_assign_to_object_dim Zend/zend_execute.c:1437:2
    - ZEND_ASSIGN_DIM_SPEC_CV_CONST_OP_DATA_CONST_HANDLER Zend/zend_vm_execute.h:41725:4
    - execute_ex Zend/zend_vm_execute.h:55866:7
    - zend_execute Zend/zend_vm_execute.h:60439:2
    - zend_execute_scripts Zend/zend.c:1842:4
    - php_execute_script main/main.c:2578:13
    - do_cli sapi/cli/php_cli.c:964:5
    - main sapi/cli/php_cli.c:1334:18

previously allocated by thread T0 here:
    - tracked_malloc Zend/zend_alloc.c:2832:14
    - _malloc_custom Zend/zend_alloc.c:2477:10
    - _emalloc Zend/zend_alloc.c:2596:10
    - zend_objects_new Zend/zend_objects.c:186:24
    - _object_and_properties_init Zend/zend_API.c:1696:22
    - object_init_ex Zend/zend_API.c:1719:9
    - ZEND_NEW_SPEC_CONST_UNUSED_HANDLER Zend/zend_vm_execute.h:10309:6
    - execute_ex Zend/zend_vm_execute.h:55866:7
    - zend_execute Zend/zend_vm_execute.h:60439:2
    - zend_execute_scripts Zend/zend.c:1842:4
    - php_execute_script main/main.c:2578:13
    - do_cli sapi/cli/php_cli.c:964:5
    - main sapi/cli/php_cli.c:1334:18


To fix this issue, follow the advice below:

1. Set pointers to NULL immediately after freeing them to prevent accidental reuse.
2. Ensure that each allocated memory block is freed only once.
3. Track memory allocations and deallocations systematically to prevent use-after-free conditions.
4. Consider swap the order of freeing memory and accessing it.

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

validate
message.result:
Sorry, the patch is incorrect. Here is the applied patch, which may have been revised and differ from the original:
diff --git a/ext/spl/spl_dllist.c b/ext/spl/spl_dllist.c
index 186b9a34c7e..afe7b81f817 100644
--- a/ext/spl/spl_dllist.c
+++ b/ext/spl/spl_dllist.c
@@ -737,8 +737,10 @@ PHP_METHOD(SplDoublyLinkedList, offsetSet)
 		if (element != NULL) {
 			/* the element is replaced, delref the old one as in
 			 * SplDoublyLinkedList::pop() */
-			zval_ptr_dtor(&element->data);
-			ZVAL_COPY(&element->data, value);
+           zval tmp;
+           ZVAL_COPY(&tmp, value);
+           zval_ptr_dtor(&element->data);
+           ZVAL_COPY_VALUE(&element->data, &tmp);
 		} else {
 			zval_ptr_dtor(value);
 			zend_argument_error(spl_ce_OutOfRangeException, 1, "is an invalid offset");

message.name: validate
message.result:
Sorry, the patch is incorrect. Here is the applied patch, which may have been revised and differ from the original:
diff --git a/ext/spl/spl_dllist.c b/ext/spl/spl_dllist.c
index 186b9a34c7e..2b3a21ed1e6 100644
--- a/ext/spl/spl_dllist.c
+++ b/ext/spl/spl_dllist.c
@@ -735,10 +735,12 @@ PHP_METHOD(SplDoublyLinkedList, offsetSet)
 		element = spl_ptr_llist_offset(intern->llist, index, intern->flags & SPL_DLLIST_IT_LIFO);
 
 		if (element != NULL) {
-			/* the element is replaced, delref the old one as in
-			 * SplDoublyLinkedList::pop() */
-			zval_ptr_dtor(&element->data);
-			ZVAL_COPY(&element->data, value);
+           SPL_LLIST_ADDREF(element); /* Prevent element from being freed during dtor */
+           zval_ptr_dtor(&element->data);
+           if (SPL_LLIST_RC(element) > 1) { /* Still valid */
+               ZVAL_COPY(&element->data, value);
+           }
+           SPL_LLIST_DELREF(element);
 		} else {
 			zval_ptr_dtor(value);
 			zend_argument_error(spl_ce_OutOfRangeException, 1, "is an invalid offset");

38| 
39| static const zend_rc_dtor_func_t zend_rc_dtor_func[] = {
40| 	/* IS_UNDEF        */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,
41| 	/* IS_NULL         */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,
42| 	/* IS_FALSE        */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,

44| 	/* IS_LONG         */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,
45| 	/* IS_DOUBLE       */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,
46| 	/* IS_STRING       */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_string_destroy,
47| 	/* IS_ARRAY        */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_array_destroy,
48| 	/* IS_OBJECT       */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_objects_store_del,
49| 	/* IS_RESOURCE     */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_list_free,
50| 	/* IS_REFERENCE    */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_reference_destroy,
51| 	/* IS_CONSTANT_AST */ (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_ast_ref_destroy
52| };
53| 
54| ZEND_API void ZEND_FASTCALL rc_dtor_func(zend_refcounted *p)
55| {
56| 	ZEND_ASSERT(GC_TYPE(p) <= IS_CONSTANT_AST);
57| 	zend_rc_dtor_func[GC_TYPE(p)](p);
58| }
59| 
60| #if ZEND_DEBUG
61| static void ZEND_FASTCALL zend_string_destroy(zend_string *str)
62| {
63| 	CHECK_ZVAL_STRING(str);
64| 	ZEND_ASSERT(!ZSTR_IS_INTERNED(str));
65| 	ZEND_ASSERT(GC_REFCOUNT(str) == 0);
66| 	ZEND_ASSERT(!(GC_FLAGS(str) & IS_STR_PERSISTENT));
67| 	efree(str);
68| }
69| #endif
70| 

We think the following hints might be helpful:
The line 57 in Zend/zend_variables.c which appears in the stack trace is:
	zend_rc_dtor_func[GC_TYPE(p)](p);

Here are the definitions of the symbols in the line:
1. variable zend_rc_dtor_func

Type: const zend_rc_dtor_func_t[12] (aka void (*const[12])(struct _zend_refcounted *))
Value = {&zend_empty_destroy, &zend_empty_destroy, &zend_empty_destroy, &zend_empty_destroy, &zend_empty_destroy, &zend_empty_destroy, &_efree, &zend_array_destroy, &zend_objects_store_del, &zend_list_free, ...}

static const zend_rc_dtor_func_t zend_rc_dtor_func[] = {
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_empty_destroy,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)_efree,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_array_destroy,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_objects_store_del,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_list_free,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_reference_destroy,
    (zend_rc_dtor_func_t)zend_ast_ref_destroy}
2. macro GC_TYPE
provided by "zend_types.h"

663| #define GC_TYPE(p)					zval_gc_type(GC_TYPE_INFO(p))

665| #define GC_INFO(p)					zval_gc_info(GC_TYPE_INFO(p))
666| 
667| #define GC_ADD_FLAGS(p, flags) do { \
668| 		GC_TYPE_INFO(p) |= (flags) << GC_FLAGS_SHIFT; \
669| 	} while (0)
670| #define GC_DEL_FLAGS(p, flags) do { \
671| 		GC_TYPE_INFO(p) &= ~((flags) << GC_FLAGS_SHIFT); \
672| 	} while (0)
673| 
674| #define Z_GC_TYPE(zval)				GC_TYPE(Z_COUNTED(zval))
675| #define Z_GC_TYPE_P(zval_p)			Z_GC_TYPE(*(zval_p))
676| 
677| #define Z_GC_FLAGS(zval)			GC_FLAGS(Z_COUNTED(zval))
678| #define Z_GC_FLAGS_P(zval_p)		Z_GC_FLAGS(*(zval_p))
679| 
680| #define Z_GC_INFO(zval)				GC_INFO(Z_COUNTED(zval))
681| #define Z_GC_INFO_P(zval_p)			Z_GC_INFO(*(zval_p))
682| #define Z_GC_TYPE_INFO(zval)		GC_TYPE_INFO(Z_COUNTED(zval))
683| #define Z_GC_TYPE_INFO_P(zval_p)	Z_GC_TYPE_INFO(*(zval_p))
684| 
685| /* zval_gc_flags(zval.value->gc.u.type_info) (common flags) */
686| #define GC_NOT_COLLECTABLE			(1<<4)
687| #define GC_PROTECTED                (1<<5) /* used for recursion detection */
688| #define GC_IMMUTABLE                (1<<6) /* can't be changed in place */
689| #define GC_PERSISTENT               (1<<7) /* allocated using malloc */
690| #define GC_PERSISTENT_LOCAL         (1<<8) /* persistent, but thread-local */
691| 
692| #define GC_NULL						(IS_NULL         | (GC_NOT_COLLECTABLE << GC_FLAGS_SHIFT))
693| #define GC_STRING					(IS_STRING       | (GC_NOT_COLLECTABLE << GC_FLAGS_SHIFT))
694| #define GC_ARRAY					IS_ARRAY
695| #define GC_OBJECT					IS_OBJECT
696| #define GC_RESOURCE					(IS_RESOURCE     | (GC_NOT_COLLECTABLE << GC_FLAGS_SHIFT))
697| #define GC_REFERENCE				(IS_REFERENCE    | (GC_NOT_COLLECTABLE << GC_FLAGS_SHIFT))
698| #define GC_CONSTANT_AST				(IS_CONSTANT_AST | (GC_NOT_COLLECTABLE << GC_FLAGS_SHIFT))
699| 
700| /* zval.u1.v.type_flags */
